name: sign.mt
keyFeatures: Neural machine translation for sign languages
fullDescription: sign.mt is dedicated to advancing sign language translation using state-of-the-art neural machine translation models through SignWriting. The company focuses on building high-quality datasets and developing AI-driven solutions that enable real-time translation between spoken and signed languages. With a strong emphasis on research and accessibility, sign.mt collaborates with academic institutions and contributes to open-source initiatives, helping to bridge communication gaps for the deaf community and businesses seeking inclusive solutions.

name: Signapse
keyFeatures: Photorealistic signing avatars
customers: Transport companies, websites and video markets
fullDescription: Signapse specializes in dictionary based sign language translation, offering photorealistic signers capable of translating content from spoken languages into British Sign Language (BSL) and American Sign Language (ASL). The company serves various sectors, including transportation companies, websites, and video markets, and is dedicated to improving accessibility through advanced AI technology.

name: VSLLabs
keyFeatures: Quick delivery using a 3D avatar, and end-to-end support
fullDescription: VSLLabs provides real-time 3D sign language translation using AI, focusing on translating spoken content into American Sign Language (ASL). The company caters to websites, apps, and video content creators, emphasizing digital inclusivity and rapid delivery of translations through their 3D avatar technology.

name: Sign-Speak
customers: Businesses, Deaf and Hard of Hearing individuals
keyFeatures: AI-powered real-time translation, advanced sign language recognition, 24/7 availability, budget-friendly solutions
fullDescription: Sign-Speak is a U.S.-based company specializing in AI-driven real-time translation services between American Sign Language (ASL) and spoken English. Their platform employs advanced machine learning techniques to recognize and translate sign language, enabling seamless communication for businesses and individuals. With a focus on accessibility, Sign-Speak offers scalable, budget-friendly solutions available 24/7, ensuring high-quality interactions across various platforms and industries.

name: SLAIT
keyFeatures: Video Communication
additionalInformation: Also behind the education platform: [https://slait.school](https://slait.school/)
fullDescription: SLAIT offers real-time ASL translation services, focusing on video communication, including VRI/VRS services. They provide a platform for video interactions that support both spoken-to-signed and signed-to-spoken language translation. SLAIT also runs an educational platform aimed at enhancing ASL learning and accessibility.

name: EQ4All
keyFeatures: 3D Avatar
additionalInformation: Avatar integrates with Unity, Unreal, and WebGL
fullDescription: EQ4All specializes in avatar-based sign language translation, utilizing a neural and rule-based hybrid translation engine to provide accessible communication tools across various platforms, including public institutions, museums, and kiosks. The company's 3D avatars integrate with popular engines like Unity, Unreal, and WebGL, aiming to eliminate barriers for the deaf and hard of hearing.

name: Sign Time GmbH
keyFeatures: Sign language post editing, customizeable appearances
additionalInformation: Uses an automated animation system with professional review
fullDescription: Sign Time GmbH focuses on providing quick and cost-effective sign language translation through animated avatars. They are a leading partner in the SiMAX project and offer semi-automated sign-language translation as a cloud service, helping to break digital barriers for deaf individuals in public institutions and businesses.

name: We Hear You, Inc
keyFeatures: Have Pierre Paul as their CEO
additionalInformation: Work with Signapse
fullDescription: We Hear You LLC is dedicated to bridging communication gaps for the Deaf community through various tools and services, including ASL-to-text and speech translation. The company partners with Signapse and focuses on providing real-time translation solutions across digital and physical platforms, offering additional accessibility products like the Push door opener.

name: SignAll Technologies
keyFeatures: Unclear
additionalInformation: Either went bankrupt, or in deep stealth since 2021
fullDescription: SignAll Technologies provides real-time ASL translation services using AI and computer vision. They offer bi-directional translation between ASL and English, focusing on educational and workplace environments. Although currently operating in deep stealth mode or possibly ceased operations, they previously served businesses, educational institutions, and individuals.

name: HandTalk
keyFeatures: Available
additionalInformation: Over 2 billion words translated.
fullDescription: HandTalk is known for its AI-powered translation of text and audio into Brazilian Sign Language (Libras), with additional support for ASL. The company provides a mobile app and web plugin, enhancing communication accessibility for the Deaf community in Brazil and the United States, with over 2 billion words translated through its platforms.

name: Deafinitely
customers: Websites and video markets, public spaces, deaf community
keyFeatures: Chat interface, QR code for public spaces
fullDescription: Deafinitely provides real-time sign language translation and communication tools, including a chat interface and QR codes for public spaces. Supporting Israeli Sign Language (ISL), BSL, and ASL, the company serves websites, video markets, and public institutions, known for its innovative solutions like the patented SignChat app for real-time message translation.

name: EASIER Project
keyFeatures: Large collaboration
additionalInformation: 3 years, limited EU project
fullDescription: The EASIER Project is a European initiative focused on creating an intelligent automatic sign language translation system. The project includes 14 institutions across Europe and supports multiple sign languages, aiming to develop a barrier-free communication framework, involving continuous feedback from Deaf communities and incorporating advanced technologies for sign language recognition and animation.

name: SignON Project
keyFeatures: Model that translates from any modality to any modality
additionalInformation: 3 years, limited EU project
fullDescription: The SignON Project aims to develop a mobile application for real-time translation between sign and spoken languages, including Irish, British, Dutch, Flemish, and Spanish Sign Languages. The project incorporates community-driven feedback and focuses on creating an open communications framework that supports fair and inclusive communication across Europe.

name: BrightSign Glove
keyFeatures: Using gloves, user teaches the language
additionalInformation: Supports "all" languages meaning that the user can teach the glove. However, only manual signs
fullDescription: BrightSign Glove develops gloves capable of translating sign language into spoken words and text in real-time. The company emphasizes accessibility and usability, allowing users to teach the glove their specific sign language. Although the product supports all sign languages, its focus is primarily on manual signs, making it a versatile tool for Deaf individuals globally.

name: Abili-Tech Systems
keyFeatures: Translation between different sign languages
additionalInformation: Contacted [sign.mt](http://sign.mt/) for help
fullDescription: Abili-Tech Systems provides real-time sign language translation through a user-friendly interface, offering text-to-sign, sign-to-text, and sign-to-speech translation services. The company focuses on bridging communication gaps between sign language and spoken language users, particularly in educational and business environments, with seamless integration across devices.

name: Spokhand
keyFeatures: Customizable photorealistic signers
additionalInformation: Focuses on bridging the gap between spoken and sign languages using advanced AI technology and virtual avatars for improved communication [source](https://www.spokhand.io).

name: Ives / MotionSign
keyFeatures: Motion capture dictionary

name: Keia
keyFeatures: AI-powered translation, contextualized sign language
additionalInformation: Combines AI with expert human teams to provide contextualized sign language translations, ensuring accurate and accessible communication. Recognized for innovation and inclusivity efforts in France.
fullDescription: Has deal with the French government for the next 4 years. Example bottom right. Human corrected and edited.

name: GoSign.AI
customers: Deaf and Hard of Hearing community, researchers, businesses
keyFeatures: Extremely diverse sign language datasets
fullDescription: GoSign.AI is a global AI research hub driven by the Deaf community, offering innovative solutions such as sign language datasets, AI chatbots, generative AI art, and sign language recognition technologies. Their gamified platforms collect high-quality, consented sign language data to fuel advancements in accessibility and communication for Deaf and Hard of Hearing individuals. They are active members of CoSET, advocating for robust AI regulations and equity in technology.

name: Migam.ai
customers: Deaf and hard-of-hearing individuals, businesses, public institutions
keyFeatures: AI-driven video-to-text and text-to-video sign language translation, real-time translation
fullDescription: Migam.ai is an advanced AI-driven project based in Poland, specializing in real-time video-to-text and text-to-video sign language translation. Utilizing a custom-built Transformer architecture, the platform ensures high accuracy and fluidity in translations, facilitating seamless communication between deaf and hearing individuals. Migam.ai collaborates with various partners, including Microsoft, Orange, and the City of Warsaw, to implement its technology across multiple sectors, enhancing accessibility and inclusivity for the deaf and hard-of-hearing community.

name: SignLab
customers: Deaf individuals, families, educators, language enthusiasts
keyFeatures: Digital learning platform, AI integration, offline access
fullDescription:
SignLab is a Norwegian company specializing in making sign language learning accessible, effective, and affordable through a digital platform. Operating in over 10 countries, they collaborate with local partners to develop content tailored to various sign languages. Their platform features integrated videos and AI support, ensuring users can learn and retain sign language skills both online and offline. SignLab's mission is to bridge communication gaps for deaf individuals, their families, and communities worldwide. They operate:
  • ASL Bloom - American Sign Language
  • yoDGS - German Sign Language
  • ISL Journey - Indian Sign Language
  • LibrasLab - Brazilian Sign Language
  • Pause LSF - French Sign Language
  • Auslan Wiz - Australian Sign Language
  • Toleio - Norwegian Sign Language
  • 手言心 - Chinese Sign Language
  • Bright BSL - British Sign Language
  • MeLISegno - Italian Sign Language

name: Kara Technologies
keyFeatures: Hyper-realistic digital sign language avatars, motion capture
additionalInformation: Uses state-of-the-art motion capture technology to create avatars that translate media content into sign language. Provides emergency information access through API calls.
fullDescription:
Kara Technologies creates hyper-realistic digital sign language avatars using motion capture technology to translate various media, audio, and text content into sign language. The company focuses on improving accessibility for Deaf individuals and offers solutions for emergency messaging, media companies, and public services​([Kara Technologies](https://www.kara.tech/)
).

name: SignUp Media
keyFeatures: Human translation services, real-time interpretation
additionalInformation: Provides human-based sign language interpretation for media content, focusing on live events, businesses, and other communication needs.
fullDescription: SignUp Media offers human interpretation services in various sign languages for businesses, media companies, and live events. They aim to provide accessible communication through real-time human translation, catering to the needs of the Deaf and hard-of-hearing communities. The specific languages they support are not disclosed, emphasizing flexibility and professionalism.

name: Bond
keyFeatures: Real-time translation, small-scale services
fullDescription: Bond is developing a video communication platform specifically designed to empower Deaf and Hard of Hearing users.

name: SignNow
keyFeatures: Interpreters on demand
additionalInformation: B2B2C / B2G2C model: business/government pays, free for the deaf customer. Successful.
fullDescription: SignNow connects the Deaf community with sign language interpreters via on-demand, call-back, and pre-scheduled video calls. The company supports ISL and ASL and operates on a B2B2C and B2G2C model, where businesses and governments pay for the service, making it free for Deaf customers. SignNow provides interpreters on demand for both businesses and government agencies.

name: SignForDeaf
customers: Video communication, websites and video markets
keyFeatures: Plugins for videos, websites, PDFs, etc
fullDescription: SignForDeaf enhances accessibility through educational tools and plugins for videos, websites, and PDFs. The company supports Turkish Sign Language (TSL) and provides real-time translation services for video communication and web content, making digital content more accessible to Deaf individuals through customizable solutions for businesses and educators.

name: ASLized
keyFeatures: Teaching and learning materials
additionalInformation: Focuses on preserving ASL culture and history, and promoting ASL linguistics
fullDescription: ASLized is a non-profit organization that produces educational resources in American Sign Language (ASL). The organization focuses on promoting ASL literacy and linguistics through various materials, including the Signily app and the Journal of American Sign Languages and Literatures (JASLL). ASLized is committed to preserving ASL culture and history while providing accessible educational content.

name: The ASL App
keyFeatures: Engaging mobile app
additionalInformation: Designed by Deaf people
fullDescription: The ASL App is an educational platform designed to teach American Sign Language (ASL) through video tutorials. The app offers over 2,500 signs and phrases, along with features like slow-motion playback, video flashcards, and a favorites list. Created by Deaf individuals, The ASL App provides both free and premium content, making ASL learning accessible and engaging for a wide audience.

name: Marlee Signs
keyFeatures: High-quality video demonstrations by Marlee Matlin
additionalInformation: Celebrity App
fullDescription: Marlee Signs is an educational app created by Academy Award-winning actress Marlee Matlin. The app offers high-quality video demonstrations of ASL, covering the alphabet, numbers, common phrases, and more. It includes seven free lessons and additional lesson packs available for purchase, recognized for its effective teaching methods and dedication to making ASL accessible to learners of all levels.

name: SignSchool
keyFeatures: Interactive exercises
fullDescription: SignSchool is a free online platform that offers a comprehensive curriculum for learning American Sign Language (ASL). The platform features video lessons, interactive exercises, a dictionary, and a Word of the Day feature. SignSchool aims to bridge communication gaps between Deaf and hearing communities by providing a user-friendly, diverse learning experience that includes various signing models and dialects.

name: DeafAI
keyFeatures: AI-based virtual sign-language interpreter, real-time translation
additionalInformation: Provides affordable, on-demand sign language interpretation services, aims to replace human interpreters in various sectors including education, healthcare, and entertainment source source

name: Signer.AI
keyFeatures: AI-powered real-time translation, digital sign language companion, 3D avatars
additionalInformation: [Recognized by the Government of India and the United Nations; focuses on making communication accessible, engaging, and inclusive for the deaf community](https://signer.ai/) [source](https://signer.ai/)

name: CODA
keyFeatures: AI-generated avatars providing real-time sign language translation
additionalInformation: Founded by Shani Bibi, a Child of Deaf Adults (CODA); recognized in innovation competitions for enhancing accessibility through technology.

name: InSignLanguage
keyFeatures: Video Relay Service (VRS), face-to-face interpreting, AI-powered solutions
fullDescription: InSignLanguage Ltd. provides professional British Sign Language (BSL) interpreting services, including face-to-face and Video Relay Services (VRS). Their NRCPD-registered interpreters offer accurate, reliable communication support for Deaf clients across business, legal, medical, and public sector appointments. The company also integrates AI technology to enhance accessibility solutions.

name: ASL Now
customers: Businesses, government agencies, Deaf and Hard of Hearing individuals
keyFeatures: Direct Video Calling (DVC), live support, live chat, video remote interpreting
fullDescription: ASL Now provides accessible communication services, including Direct Video Calling (DVC), live support, live chat, and video remote interpreting, to facilitate direct communication between businesses or government agencies and Deaf or Hard of Hearing customers. Their services aim to enhance customer satisfaction and loyalty by ensuring equitable communication experiences. ASL Now is powered by Communication Service for the Deaf (CSD), an organization with a long history of pioneering accessible communication technology.

name: Sign AI
customers: Deaf and hearing individuals seeking real-time communication
keyFeatures: AI-powered virtual sign language interpretation, real-time bi-directional communication
fullDescription: Sign AI is a U.S.-based company specializing in AI-powered virtual sign language interpretation. Their mission is to facilitate real-time, bi-directional communication between Deaf and hearing individuals, promoting communication equity for all. By leveraging advanced AI technology, Sign AI aims to ensure clear and complete understanding in every conversation, thereby bridging communication gaps and enhancing accessibility.

name: SignAvatar
customers: Public transportation hubs, airports, train stations
keyFeatures: AI-powered real-time sign language translation, customizable avatars
fullDescription: SignAvatar is a Serbian startup specializing in AI-driven sign language translation. Their flagship product, TransportSign™, provides real-time sign language interpretations of public announcements in transportation hubs, enhancing accessibility for the Deaf and hard-of-hearing community. The company offers customizable avatars to reflect diverse identities and cultures, aiming to bridge communication gaps in public spaces.

name: DeepSignAI
customers: Deaf and Hard of Hearing individuals, businesses, public institutions
keyFeatures: AI-driven solutions, real-time translation, community engagement
fullDescription: DeepSign is a Hungary-based company dedicated to developing AI solutions that enhance communication and accessibility for the Deaf and Hard of Hearing community. Led by a Deaf co-founder and CEO, the team comprises both Deaf and hearing professionals proficient in sign language. DeepSign focuses on creating innovative AI-driven tools for real-time translation between spoken and signed languages. Currently operating in stealth mode, the company is engaging with local Deaf communities through initiatives like the DeepSign AI Discovery Tour to understand their needs and explore how AI can effectively address daily challenges.

name: OmniBridge
customers: Deaf and hearing individuals seeking real-time communication
keyFeatures: AI-driven machine translation, real-time bi-directional communication
fullDescription: OmniBridge develops AI technology for real-time American Sign Language (ASL) translation, facilitating bi-directional communication between Deaf and hearing individuals. Their mission is to bridge the communication gap by enabling seamless conversations through AI-driven machine translation technology. Founded by Adam Munder, a Deaf software engineer, the company is dedicated to enhancing accessibility and inclusivity.

name: Yomma GmbH
customers: Public institutions, businesses, cultural organizations, livestream events
keyFeatures: Sign language video production, certified interpretation services, livestream sign language translation, web-based accessibility solutions
additionalInformation: Operates in Berlin, Hamburg, and Munich; SQAT web-based translation tool for accessibility
fullDescription: Yomma GmbH is a German company dedicated to sign language accessibility. They provide high-quality sign language video production, certified interpretation services, and livestream translation in German Sign Language (DGS). Their web-based tool SQAT enables barrier-free communication, aligning with the Barrierefreiheitsstärkungsgesetz (Accessibility Strengthening Act). Yomma works with public institutions, cultural organizations, and businesses to enhance inclusivity through sign language services.

name: Charamel GmbH
keyFeatures: Interactive 3D avatars, real-time animation technologies
additionalInformation: Based in Cologne, Germany; involved in research projects like EMMI for empathic human-machine interaction
fullDescription: Charamel is a IT company based in Cologne/Germany. The company vision is to bring more human touch into interactive applications by using virtual humans called avatars. Charamel is developing software for interactive and multifunctional digital assistants for a better communication between human and machine. Avatars are the next generation of a multimodal and user-friendly HMI interface face to face!

name: Batoners
customers: Deaf and hard-of-hearing individuals, visually impaired individuals, general public
keyFeatures: Sign language translation, AI-powered assistive tools for visually impaired and disabled individuals
fullDescription: Batoners is a South Korean company developing humane technology solutions for accessibility and social inclusion. Their key projects include a Sign Language Translator (BSLT) using AI to convert sign language into spoken or written text, an AI-driven e-book enhancement tool for the visually impaired, and a crosswalk navigation app for blind individuals. Additionally, they have developed the CCUCC Button, a child vehicle safety device. With a strong emphasis on assistive technology, Batoners is committed to creating inclusive solutions that empower people with disabilities.

name: InclusiveTech
keyFeatures: VirtualSign translation assistant
fullDescription: InclusiveTech is a Portuguese company dedicated to enhancing inclusion through new technologies for sign language. Their flagship product, VirtualSign, assists individuals experiencing communication barriers by providing a translation assistant aimed at improving social and educational inclusion.

name: Silence Speaks
customers: Deaf and hard of hearing individuals, businesses, public and private enterprises
keyFeatures: AI-powered real-time sign language translation, automated translation for websites, customer interaction assistance
fullDescription: Silence Speaks is a UK-based AI-driven platform dedicated to bridging communication gaps for the deaf and hard of hearing community. It offers real-time sign language translation services for industries such as banking, retail, and telecommunications. Their vision is to serve 250,000 British Sign Language users by 2025 and expand globally to support 70 million sign language users worldwide. The company is a member of the British Deaf Association, National Deaf Children’s Society, and the Royal National Institute for Deaf People.

name: Motion Light Lab
customers: Deaf children, educators, researchers, digital storytellers
keyFeatures: ASL-English bilingual storybook apps, motion-capture signing avatars, immersive AR/VR learning experiences
fullDescription: Motion Light Lab is an award-winning creative research lab at Gallaudet University specializing in sign language learning and literacy development through emerging technologies. They develop ASL-English bilingual storybook apps, motion-capture signing avatars, and immersive AR/VR learning experiences. Their work supports the literacy development of Deaf children while also advancing research on sign-centric learning experiences. They are also the creators of the CREST Network, a National Science Foundation-funded initiative fostering discussions and collaborations in sign language technology.

name: BuHamad
customers: Deaf and hard-of-hearing individuals, government agencies, businesses
keyFeatures: AI-powered virtual 3D interpreter for Qatari Sign Language, real-time translation, government and business integration
fullDescription: BuHamad is the first Qatari virtual 3D interpreter for Qatari Sign Language, developed by Mada Center to enhance digital accessibility for the deaf and hard-of-hearing community. It provides real-time translation of Arabic text and visual content into Qatari Sign Language and can be integrated into websites and digital platforms. The Ministry of Social Development and Family has adopted BuHamad, making it the first government agency in Qatar to utilize this technology for accessibility.

name: Mind Rockets Inc.
customers: Deaf and hard-of-hearing individuals, businesses, public institutions, digital platforms
keyFeatures: AI-powered sign language avatars, web accessibility tools, chatbot and social media integrations, QR-based sign translation
fullDescription: Mind Rockets Inc. is a Jordan-based assistive technology company that develops AI-driven sign language avatars for real-time text and speech translation. Their products include sign language integration for websites, social media, chatbots, and printed materials through QR codes. They offer applications such as Ramz (Jordanian Sign Language), Mimix (American Sign Language), and Al Turjuman (Saudi Sign Language) to enhance accessibility. Mind Rockets supports multiple Arabic sign languages alongside ASL and BSL, working with businesses and governments to improve digital inclusion for the Deaf community.

name: alangu GmbH
keyFeatures: AI-based sign language avatar 'Livian', Kommunaler Gebärdensprach-Avatar-Baukasten (KGAB)
fullDescription: alangu GmbH is a German software company specializing in AI-based translation software that converts text into German Sign Language (DGS). Their flagship product, the Kommunaler Gebärdensprach-Avatar-Baukasten (KGAB), enables municipalities to translate their digital services into DGS, enhancing accessibility for the Deaf community. The company collaborates with both hearing and Deaf experts to develop intuitive tools like the sign language avatar 'Livian', aiming to break down digital barriers and promote inclusivity. In 2024, alangu was awarded the DigitalMediaAward Germany in the category of Digital Innovation for their KGAB solution.

name: SIGN
keyFeatures: Real-time ASL translation using standard webcams
fullDescription: SIGN is a real-time American Sign Language (ASL) translation service that converts ASL into text using standard webcams and machine learning. Developed as a senior design project at the University of Pennsylvania, it offers a desktop application for Windows and macOS, enabling users to generate live captions from their signing. The tool aims to improve accessibility for various scenarios, including healthcare consultations, business interactions, and daily communication. SIGN is free for personal use, while developers and enterprises can access SDKs and premium support through subscription plans.

name: Signbridge AI
keyFeatures: Conversational AI agent for real-time bi-directional sign language translation
fullDescription: Signbridge AI is a Canada-based company developing conversational AI agents for real-time, bi-directional translation between spoken English and American Sign Language (ASL). The platform leverages computer vision and natural language understanding to enable fluid interaction between Deaf and hearing individuals. Signbridge AI focuses on applications in education, healthcare, and business, aiming to create accessible, scalable communication tools for inclusive environments.
